Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a brown pottery vessel, the fabric is greyish in section, the interior is covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, the exterior is slightly grooved, covered with a red-brown slip and faint traces of five lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394766) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394766)
